_header: As I came walking by the way / I saw a sight seemly to see
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 179.
_description: A song of the Angels appearing to the Shepherds — four 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) including a Latin refrain, ‘Veritas de terra orta est’ plus burden (cc): ‘Man move thy mynd and ioy this fest / Verytas de terra orta est’

OxfBal354.First Lines:
As I cam by þe wayI sawe a sight semly to
                    see…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Tyll they cam þer they wold not restTo Iury &
                        IerusalemVeritas de terra orta estExplicit
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:

         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).
